name: alloc::layout::Layout::repeat_packed

num::<impl usize>::checked_mul.doc:
Checked integer multiplication. Computes `self * rhs`, returning
 `None` if overflow occurred.


alloc::layout::Layout::from_size_alignme.doc: Internal helper constructor to skip revalidating alignment validity.

option::Option: Unknown([Downcast(VariantIdx(1, ThreadLocalIndex)), Field(0, Ty { id: 47, kind: RigidTy(Uint(Usize)) })])

doc:
Creates a layout describing the record for `n` instances of
 `self`, with no padding between each instance.

 Note that, unlike `repeat`, `repeat_packed` does not guarantee
 that the repeated instances of `self` will be properly
 aligned, even if a given instance of `self` is properly
 aligned. In other words, if the layout returned by
 `repeat_packed` is used to allocate an array, it is not
 guaranteed that all elements in the array will be properly
 aligned.

 On arithmetic overflow, returns `LayoutError`.
